definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The first prize was awarded to the best competitor of the annual sports meeting .
sentences.chinese: 頭獎頒給了這一年一度的運動會上最優秀的運動員。

sentences.english: I was excited like I won the jackpot.
sentences.chinese: 我就像中了頭獎一樣興奮。

sentences.english: Max:I really hope our lottery ticket will win the jackpot.
sentences.chinese: 真希望我們的彩券可以中頭獎。

sentences.english: First prize in the raffle is a holiday for two in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 抽獎銷售的頭獎是兩個人到巴黎度假旅遊。

sentences.english: No one but Johnny and his son was able to get the first prize.
sentences.chinese: 只有約翰和他的兒子才得以獲得頭獎。

sentences.english: There was no first prize winner for the draw for the fifth consecutive time.
sentences.chinese: 已經連續五次攪珠無人中頭獎。

sentences.english: She won first prize in the 100 metres race.
sentences.chinese: 她在百米賽跑中獲頭獎。

sentences.english: LUCK】She had luck to win first prize.
But the sound of a jackpot needs no translation.
sentences.chinese: 但是中頭獎的聲音無需任何修飾。

sentences.english: The first prize was bestowed upon the winner.
The first prize for Biology went to the youngest child in the class.
sentences.chinese: 生物學頭獎歸於班上年齡最小的那位學生。

sentences.english: excited like I won the jackpot .
sentences.chinese: 我就像中了頭獎一樣興奮。

sentences.english: Perhaps next time, I’ll be luckier and win the jackpot!
sentences.chinese: 也許下一次吧，我會幸運贏得頭獎。

sentences.english: The first prize is a big screen TV.
sentences.chinese: 頭獎是一臺大熒幕電視。

definition: winner/lucky guy/person who always gets good breaks
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
the full amount/to fulfill the quota
to count and check/to tally/points (collected in some bonus scheme etc)
